metadata.title: CVE-2014-2287 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
channels/chan_sip.c in Asterisk Open Source 1.8.x before 1.8.26.1, 11.8.xbefore 11.8.1, and 12.1.x before 12.1.1, and Certified Asterisk 1.8.15before 1.8.15-cert5 and 11.6 before 11.6-cert2, when chan_sip has a certainconfiguration, allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial ofservice (channel and file descriptor consumption) via an INVITE requestwith a (1) Session-Expires or (2) Min-SE header with a malformed or invalidvalue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:11.8.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
